ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: as a reminder. We were never unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: To warn. For We are never unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: to admonish them. We have never been unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We have never been unjust to anyone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: To advise; and We never oppress.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: By way of reminder, and We have never been unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: To remind, and We are never unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: for a reminder; and never did We wrong.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: For reminder, for We never were oppressors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: as a reminder from Us: We are never unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By way of admonition, and We have never been oppressors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: for the sake of admonition, and We were not unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By way of reminder; and We never are unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: By way of reminder, and We have never been unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: for a reminder, and We never harmed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: As a reminder—We are never unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:209] as a reminder, an admonition for them; for We were never unjust, for We destroy them [only] after they have been warned. The following was revealed to refute what the idolaters were saying:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (For reminder) they remind them of Allah's punishment, (for We never were oppressors) by destroying them.
